You get DualWielding, 1 higher AB, 40 more hitpoints, 1 more damage. You lose IKD (which is good for PvM) and shield prof in addition to SC V. There are ways of having 50% concealment anyhow, so SC V is no big loss.
Missing out on the shield prof hurts, there are plenty of times where I want that AC. On Anti-World I did this Fighter10/SD1/Rogue29. In that setting you can't immediately go back to stealth, so you'll need to stick it out in shield mode after the initial flurry. In settings where HiPS is altered, you'll want the shield.

For shield, there is simply not room pre-epic. You can go with the standard Ab scores STR11, DEX19, CON 14 to drop one GrDEX in Epic for the shield.

I was gonna say that too. DWind is VERY HANDY in any DA-heavy build. 38 DC is very good. I'd consider going Elf and dropping 2 CON for 1 STR, and reworking starting stats to begin with 20 DEX or you could use your second alternative and take AS.

I remember you showing me this build when I posted my Ranger 8 Wizard 10 Assassin 22 build in the Build Request forum of the old guild 3 or 4 years ago. It was an excellent build then and it's still an excellent build now. Like then, I'd prefer dropping SCV for more Great Dex feats and higher AB/AC. SCV is VERY GOOD, but I'd save that for builds with Fighter levels so you can rely on some bonus feats to help you attain it without dropping too much combat prowess.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
To what you say above, it's environment-dependant. I have played somewhere where you'd need to go either Shortsword or Kukri because no good daggers were available. But if there are good of both, I guess you're right. At least with the 10 str 20 dex alternative, with the other one, I prefer my elf

The way I fight with sneakers, I don't particularly have much use for HPs, unless you count surviving IGMS or something, but I prefer a stack of Greater Spell Mantle scrolls. The only thing with this build that can be a problem is that it only gets HiPS at 21 for maximizing BAB, so that means many Invisibility Potions for Death Attacks and KD attempts, using Darkness and stuff like that.

This isn't the first time I have discussed the low HPs on a build thing. To me, what low HP means in game is that you need to pay more attention, react faster before you take a dirtnap. I can do that most of the time, and the times I can't, well, I just die . But still that doesn't happen often enough to be a major concern. I always take out casters first, then run like hell before I get surrounded and come back after a few monsters have abandoned the chase. Then if I have Darkness, I'll use it for "HiPS" or I can simply hide again if I already have HiPS. I don't really get why you guys value HPs so much, maybe I'm missing something, but to me HPs means comfort of having more time to make decisions, which is something I generally don't need. There has been no obstacle in my 7-year NWN career which I haven't been able to overcome due to the lack of HPs, and it's not like we haven't played in the same places, so tell, me, why is it that you think so highly of HPs?

Take it EZ!

HPs are a measure of how long you can fight (excluded save or die stuff evidently). The more you have, the longer you can fight before having to swallow a heal potion (which conversely is worth more to someone having higher HPs). Think of a normal heal potion, not of a 150 or 250 Hps capped one.

Roughly speaking (as a rule of thumb) I want my meleers to get 400+ HPs and my casters to get 300+ HPs. In the case of a very defensive build one can accommodate for lower HPs (my pale sneaker of doom Rogue/PM with ED, SCV and crit immunity has 338 HPs eg) but this guy would be getting less than 300 HPs (282 to be precise) if he were to drop CON by 2 points. That's way too little for me. His 322 points are already lower than desired.
